summary.text:
Accelerating Biomedical Research Act

This bill amends the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 to require certain adjustments to the annual discretionary spending limits for FY2019-FY2021 to accommodate increases in appropriations to the National Institutes of Health at the Department of Health and Human Services.

bill.title: Accelerating Biomedical Research Act

item.title: To prioritize funding for the National Institutes of Health to discover treatments and cures, to maintain global leadership in medical innovation, and to restore the purchasing power which the National Institutes of Health had after the historic doubling campaign that ended in fiscal year 2003.

dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
